justification_25w: Reducing inequality has merit but high taxes often reduce incentives and growth.
steelman_opposite_25w: Extreme inequality can destabilize society and reduce overall welfare.

justification_25w: Safety nets prevent extreme poverty and stabilize society.
steelman_opposite_25w: Large welfare states can create dependency and disincentivize work.

justification_25w: Competition drives innovation and efficiency far better than central planning.
steelman_opposite_25w: Unregulated markets can produce monopolies and externalities.

justification_25w: Unions can improve conditions but often raise costs and reduce flexibility.
steelman_opposite_25w: Strong unions historically lifted wages and safety standards.

justification_25w: Helps low-wage workers but frequently causes job losses or hours cuts.
steelman_opposite_25w: Carefully set minimum wages can boost earnings without large disemployment.

justification_25w: Lower corporate taxes attract capital and spur investment and jobs.
steelman_opposite_25w: High taxes can still fund public goods that enable growth.

justification_25w: Wealth taxes often cause capital flight and raise little revenue.
steelman_opposite_25w: Extreme concentrations of wealth threaten democratic equality.

justification_25w: Immigration brings skills, labor, innovation, and cultural vitality.
steelman_opposite_25w: High inflows can strain infrastructure and lower wages temporarily.

justification_25w: Enforcing borders maintains rule of law and public trust.
steelman_opposite_25w: Strict deportation can separate families and be inhumane.

justification_25w: Criminalizing personal use wastes resources and ruins lives unnecessarily.
steelman_opposite_25w: Some drugs remain highly addictive and dangerous to society.

justification_25w: Bodily autonomy and women’s rights justify legal access in most cases.
steelman_opposite_25w: Late-term abortions raise serious moral questions about fetal life.

justification_25w: Order is valuable but expanding police powers risks abuse.
steelman_opposite_25w: Strong policing deters crime and protects vulnerable citizens.

justification_25w: Constraints prevent overreach and protect civil liberties.
steelman_opposite_25w: Fewer constraints can enable more effective crime reduction.

justification_25w: Reasonable regulations reduce mass shootings and suicides.
steelman_opposite_25w: Tight rules disproportionately burden law-abiding owners.

justification_25w: Hate speech laws often slide into censorship of political views.
steelman_opposite_25w: Protecting minorities from targeted harassment has value.

justification_25w: Free speech is foundational; offensive speech must be tolerated.
steelman_opposite_25w: Unrestricted speech can incite real violence or harm.

justification_25w: Privacy is a core right; mass surveillance erodes trust.
steelman_opposite_25w: Targeted surveillance has prevented major attacks.

justification_25w: Security gains sometimes justify it, but scope creep is real.
steelman_opposite_25w: Bulk collection rarely stops plots that couldn’t be caught otherwise.

justification_25w: Avoiding catastrophic warming outweighs near-term energy cost increases.
steelman_opposite_25w: High costs hurt the poorest most and slow development.

justification_25w: Nuclear is reliable, low-carbon, and scalable at scale.
steelman_opposite_25w: Waste and accident risks, though low, remain serious.

justification_25w: Subsidies accelerated deployment but often pick inefficient winners.
steelman_opposite_25w: Market-distorting subsidies can delay cheaper grid parity.

justification_25w: Some antitrust action needed but heavy regulation stifles innovation.
steelman_opposite_25w: Dominant platforms abuse power and entrench monopolies.

justification_25w: Over-moderation frequently suppresses valid speech and creates bias.
steelman_opposite_25w: Unchecked misinformation can cause public harm rapidly.

justification_25w: Moderation often amplifies institutional bias and reduces discourse quality.
steelman_opposite_25w: Leaving harmful content can spread dangerous falsehoods.

justification_25w: Some oversight needed but strict pre-deployment rules slow progress.
steelman_opposite_25w: Rapid deployment without guardrails risks major societal harm.

justification_25w: Over-regulation already chokes innovation more than current harms.
steelman_opposite_25w: Unregulated AI could produce catastrophic misalignment.

justification_25w: Depends heavily on the geopolitical context and current threats.
steelman_opposite_25w: Strong defense deters aggression and preserves peace.

justification_25w: Targeted aid can save lives and build goodwill.
steelman_opposite_25w: Domestic poverty and infrastructure often more pressing.

justification_25w: Centralization reduces national democratic control and flexibility.
steelman_opposite_25w: More integration can solve collective-action problems better.

justification_25w: Subsidiarity favors decisions at the lowest effective level.
steelman_opposite_25w: Returning powers risks fragmentation and inefficiency.

justification_25w: Experts often right on technical issues but ignore values/trade-offs.
steelman_opposite_25w: Public sentiment reflects lived experience experts may miss.

justification_25w: Majority can be swayed by misinformation or short-termism.
steelman_opposite_25w: Democracy requires deference to majority will in the end.

justification_25w: Basic scientific fact known for centuries.
steelman_opposite_25w: Flat-Earth or geocentrism views persist in fringes.

justification_25w: Objective geographic and political fact.
steelman_opposite_25w: No serious dispute exists.
